Rglobalflourishing 0.1.0

    Estimate and Save Attrition Weights

    append_attrition_wgts.Rd

    The default set of predictors: "ANNUAL_WEIGHT1_W1", "MODE_RECRUIT_W1", "AGE_W1", "GENDER_W1", "EDUCATION_3_W1", "EMPLOYMENT_W1", "MARITAL_STATUS_W1", "RACE_PLURALITY_W1".

    append_attrition_wgts(
  data,
  attr.pred = NULL,
  stabilized = TRUE,
  robust = FALSE,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    data

    a pre-cleaned and mostly ready for analysis data.frame that will be used to construct attrition weights.

    attr.pred

    (character vector) default to NULL, a vector of variables to be used as predictors of staying in the study at wave 2

    stabilized

    (logical) default to TRUE, where the estimated attrition weight is the divisor and the numerator is the baseline rate of attrition (if FALSE, then the numerator is fixed to 1)

    robust

    (logical) default to FALSE, of whether to use a "robust" variant of probit regression (uses the robustbase package instead of the survey package to get weights).

    ...

    other arguments passed to svyglm or glmrob functions

    Value

    a dataset with attrition weights appended

    Details

    Estimate (save fitted model) and append attrition weights to data.frame

    Examples

    {
  # TO-DO
}
#> NULL
